website_summaries.verdict: A liquid dewormer that works well for treating roundworms and comes at an affordable price.
pros: Liquid form that's easy to administer
Treats roundworms, which are common in cats
A popular dewormer by a top brand in pet care
cons: Doesn't work for a broad range of worms

customer_reviews.title: Miracle worker
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes to hunt and play outdoors and ate a few lizards, she contracted a parasite which caused her to stop eating and she lost close to 5lbs. She was still drinking water so I gave her a dose of this and she slowly started eating again and gained her weight back. She was so playful and back to her regular self!
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a low price. I added some to the cat food for a feral cat I have been feeding. His health has improved greatly thanks to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffry Moser

customer_reviews.title: Mix with wet food
customer_reviews.text: If I make sure my “outdoor” cats are hungry, and I give it to them mixed with wet food they like.... no problem! They gobble it down. I have noticed a significant reduction in them vomiting worms so it appears to be working.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sublette

customer_reviews.title: Worked for feral
customer_reviews.text: I have a feral cat I take care of. Took care of his round worms. Easy to give, is liquid form and mixed in wet cat food he ate it right up, can’t say the same about crushed pills
customer_reviews.author: K. Chianos

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Is Still Healthy
customer_reviews.text: My cat is basically an outdoor cat. Kinda 50/50 depending on the weather. Soon to be 12 years old I worry about her health. This is a small price to pay to keep her from worms and other dangers. Been using this product for years and she is still an active and happy kitty. Recomended
customer_reviews.author: terrance pae

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is easy to administer
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work well, all the cats I have given it to have happily eatin it and it is very reasonably priced. I used to buy the paste buy the same brand in a small syringe which was sometimes easier to dose but this works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: BETSY SAWYERS

customer_reviews.title: Cats HATED this
customer_reviews.text: My cats avoided the bowl I mixed it in and would not drink. We ended up putting it down their mouths and they sputtered and coughed for an hour. We still had to get a much more expensive dewormer from the vet afterward which actually worked.
customer_reviews.author: J.P,

customer_reviews.title: other products by Hartz work wonderfully, however
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's okay, other products by Hartz work wonderfully, however, the promise of a flavor cats love apparently isn't a flavor mine does (but she does love their hairball medicine, tho). It probably works great, but she won't even taste it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: This was needed after successful flea treatment,
customer_reviews.text: Mixed with can food with gravy, no problems. But I kept them on dry food for the next day or so, in case it give them any loose stools. I did this on the second treatment, having seen results after first.
customer_reviews.author: Oneeye

customer_reviews.title: Almost killed my cats
customer_reviews.text: This almost killed my cats. I called the Vets after they got sick by this dewormer and they said they do not recommend it because it has severe side effects.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Works but Bad taste
customer_reviews.text: The cats don’t like the taste. It’s hard to get them to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Faye Mother Earth Apothecary

customer_reviews.title: rid wormer for cats
customer_reviews.text: UH....it is rid wormer for cats .... I used it to rid the cats of worms... .... it is a time consuming process but easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kingsley

customer_reviews.title: effective
customer_reviews.text: i put this on a spoon of tuna to make sure my cat swallowed all of it-not knowing the flavor. she gobbled it all down with great results.
customer_reviews.author: sonie

customer_reviews.title: Pet Health
customer_reviews.text: This medication seemed to work well with the first dose. We gave second dose as a precaution.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Dilts

customer_reviews.title: Saved my kittens life
customer_reviews.text: My kitten has done a complete 360° since given this dewormer. She was, in my opinion, lethargic. Now shes hyper and playful and never stops playing.i couldnt be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works, not expensive, and easy to use. Like the amount for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: Worked overnight, great product and great price 👍🌞😁
customer_reviews.text: Easier than capsules, cats are it in food better than the Caps. If they smell it they won't eat, had no problem with this liquid , totally sold, on this one Thanks 😊
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I just put the cat in a cage with the food covered with the medicine. Cat ate it and no more worms.
customer_reviews.author: Don M. Lugafet Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: We took in a stray kitten who was already a good hunter. Because there was no history for this 10 mo old, we wanted to worm her and used this product. I suspected she may have roundworm because she had a round stomach. She did have round worm and this product killed them. Since this subject is gross, I will just spare you the details. But I would recommend this for anyone suspicious of roundworm to try this product.
customer_reviews.author: pegasus9000

customer_reviews.title: Can't seem to get my cat to drink the dewormer
customer_reviews.text: Finding it hard to get my cat to drink the water with drops of this in the sterile water
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work at all for my kitten I treated her four times and she still had worms I ended up having to go to Walmart and get her something
customer_reviews.author: Amber welch

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Dewormer
customer_reviews.text: Well as its not for human consumption i have no idea of the " flavor" my cats consumed it fine, no side effects except no more worms.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Cats loved it which was surprising because it smelled aweful lol
customer_reviews.author: Erica lemaster

customer_reviews.title: Work's!!!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you! The product ended up in neighbor's mail box and she brought it up to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

product_meta.title: Hartz UltraGuard Rid Worm Liquid for Cats
product_meta.description: Hartz UltraGuard Rid Worm Liquid for Cats is an easy-to-use solution for removing roundworms in cats and kittens. Simply measure one teaspoon (5mL) per 5 pounds of body weight. The syrup can be dropped directly into your pet's mouth or mixed into food. Cats may be dewormed at earliest between 6-8 weeks of age. The first treatment should be repeated 14 days later. If reinfestation is apparent, treat again in another 14 days. Be sure to store this product in a cool, dry place where temperatures do not exceed 86°F. Consult a veterinarian before using in severely debilitated animals.
feature_bullets: A mild and effective method to remove roundworms (Toxocara Canis and Toxacaris Leonia) from cats and kittens.
For use on cats and kittens 8 weeks of age and older
Easy-to-use syrup can be dropped directly into your pet's mouth or mixed into food.
The first treatment should be repeated 14 days later
Store product in a cool, dry place and avoid temperatures above 86°F
